dialogues.text: I can't stop it. I try. Oh God! Help me Jake. JACOB slides quickly out of his side of the booth and mov PAUL. He puts his arm around him and holds him tightly, o comfort as best he can. PAUL is obviously terrified and grateful for JACOB's gest PEOPLE at the bar look over in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Paul. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything. (PAUL begins to relax a bit and the shaking subsides)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen them too ... the demons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at JACOB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere, like a plague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God almighty. I thought I was the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. I had no idea. It's like I was coming apart at the seams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it Paul? What's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep telling me I'm already dead, that they're gonna tear me apart, piece by piece, and throw me into the fire. (he fumbles in his coat pocket and pulls out a small Bible and silver cross)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I carry these everywhere but they don't help. Nothing helps. Everyone thinks I'm crazy. My mother filed a report with the army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said I haven't been the same since then. Since that night. There's still this big hole in my brain. It's so dark in there, Jake. And these creatures. It's like they're crawling out of my brain. What happened that night? Why won't they tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're monsters, Jake. We're both seein' 'em. There's gotta be a connection. Something. JACOB leans back in the booth, his mind racing. The YOUNG next booth is watching them with rapt attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL and JACOB are in the MEN'S ROOM. PAUL flushes the ur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to go by myself anymore. I keep thinkin' one of 'em's gonna come up behind me. Somethin's wrong when a guy can't even take a leak by himself. I've seen 'em take people right off the street. I used to go home a different way every night. Now I can't even go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come home with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your girlfriend? You don't think she'll mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We've put up more of her cousins. You wouldn't believe how they breed down there. PAUL smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO MEN leave the bar on a dingy side street. It is c Christmas lights seem ludicrous dangling in the bar's fro PAUL looks at them and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas. PAUL steps into the street and walks to the driver's side He pulls out his keys and opens the door. JACOB looks dow sidewalk and notices a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, this is my lucky day. He bends down to pick it up. PAUL inserts the key into th steps on the gas. He turns the key. THE CAR EXPLODES. Pieces of metal and flesh fly into the sprawls out flat on the ground as the debris hurls above his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO A HELICOPTER suffering an air bombardment. Flack i all around it and the shock waves are rocking the craft v JACOB's eyes peer to the left. INFANTRY GUNNERS are firing rockets into the JUNGLE below MEDICS are huddled over him. A sudden gush of arterial bl stream of blood splattering over the inside of the windsh PILOT, unable to see, clears it away with his hands. JACOB screams over the roar of the chopper. One of the ME his ear close to JACOB to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing the best we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE YOUNG MAN from the bar grabs JACOB under the arms and down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? Who are you? The YOUNG MAN yanks JACOB around the corner just as anoth consumes the car. The air is filled with flames and flyin YOUNG MAN pulls JACOB into the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lie still. You're okay. You're not hurt. The CUSTOMERS are in a state of bedlam. Part of the wall apart and bricks and glass are everywhere. The cross from neck is buried in the debris. Sirens are heard in the dis CAR speeds off down the street. JACOB looks for the YOUNG helped him. He is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FUNERAL PROCESSION heads down Ocean Parkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB and JEZZIE are driving in an old Chevy Nova. They a JACOB's face is bruised and he has a gauze pad over his e in silence. JACOB appears very sad. Slowly his right hand across the seat, seeking JEZZIE's. Their fingers embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FUNERAL PROCESSION enters the CEMETERY. Cars park alo of the narrow road. MEN IN DARK SUITS emerge from their c WIVES and GIRLFRIENDS. They are the SOLDIERS we have seen at the opening of the they are older now. A small group of FAMILY MEMBERS are h graveside. JACOB joins the other VETERANS as pallbearers. They carry semi-military formation to the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB'S OLD ARMY BUDDIES are sitting together in Paul's l talking. PAUL'S WIFE can be seen in the BEDROOM. Several comforting her. JEZZIE is talking to a small group of LADIES in the DININ nibbling off a tray of cold cuts. PAUL'S SISTER is with h seem to be having a lively, almost intimate, conversation JACOB and his BUDDIES are drinking beer. They all have a defeated look about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone see the police report? It sounds like a detonation job to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper said it was electrical; a freak accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Someone's covering somethin'. That was no accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars don't explode that way. Any simpleton knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the paper ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was set. I'm tellin' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By who? Why? Paul didn't have an enemy in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're talkin' about Paul. Who'd want to hurt him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he talk about when you guys went out? Did he say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was upset. He thought people were following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding. Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't know ... Demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously struck by the word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, demons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me he was going to Hell. The statement has a surprising impact on the group. There silence and eyes averted from one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say that for? What made him say that? Strange, huh? Strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else did he say, Jake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was scared. He saw these creatures coming out of the woodwork. They were tryin' to get him, he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his arm shaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long had that been going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of weeks, I think. He notices GEORGE's beer can rattling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say what they looked like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not really ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me a minute. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one end, out the other, huh George? GEORGE tries to smile as he hurries to the bathroom. His out of control and beer is spilling on the carpet as he w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a spastic, huh? I hope you can hold your dick better than you hold that can. No one laughs. There is an uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SIX MEN are walking quietly through an unpaved alley. gray and getting darker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what Paul was talking about. I don't know how to say this ... but in a way it's a relief knowing that someone else saw them, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're seeing ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not human, I'll tell you that. A car tried to run over me the other day. It was aiming straight for me. I saw their faces. They weren't from Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you tellin' me? They're from the Bronx?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no joke, Rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something weird is going on here. What is it about us? Even in Nam it was always weird. Are we all crazy or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, ever since that ... He hesitates. They all understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was bad grass. That's all it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grass never did that to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been to three shrinks and a hypnotist. Nothing penetrates that night. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth goin' over again and again. Whatever happened, happened. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I've seen them, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's something fucking strange going on here. You know Paul's not the only one who's died. You remember Dr. Carlson over at Bellevue? His car blew up, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Carlson's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion, just like Paul's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they're connected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think something's fucking connect- ed. I mean, a car tried to run me  over the other day. Doug too, right?  We've got six guys here going fucking crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, not you Rod. But the rest of us are flipping out for some goddamn reason. They're tryin' to kill us. Fuck it man, we need to find out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it has something to do with ... the offensive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got something to do with some- thing. I think we've got to confront the army. If they're hiding shit from us, we better find out what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Professor. The army's not gonna give you any answers. You'll be buttin' your head against a stone wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's the only way to get through. Besides, six heads'll be better than one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my head, buddy. Not me. I'm gettin' a headache just listenin' to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get ourselves a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say you should get a shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. I've tried. I think you're right, Jake. I'm game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are fucking paranoid. It was bad grass. That's all it was. There's no such thing as demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB, FRANK, JERRY, GEORGE, DOUG, and ROD are sitting on in the LAW OFFICE of DONALD GEARY. GEARY, a red-faced man chins, is sucking on an ice cube. He looks at each of the spits the ice cube into an empty glass. It clinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Singer, but do you have any idea how many people come to me with the injustices of the world? It'd break your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't injustice, Mr. Geary. The army did something to us and we've got to find out what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The army. The army. What is it with you guys? We're not talking about a trip to the library here. This is the United States Government for God's sake. This is red tape coming out of your ass. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And we need someone to cut through it. We hear you're the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What am I - Perry Mason here? GEARY stands up and grabs a bag of Cheetos from a file dr chomps down a few and offers the bag to the others. There takers. Thirsty, he downs the ice cube and cracks it betw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll look into it. The MEN are surprised and excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Do you think we have a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, a fortune teller or a lawyer? ... I'll need sworn depositions from each of you and a list of the other members of the platoon, or their survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, if we find the  military is implicated in any way, you could stand to recover quite a lot of money. Not that I can predict anything, but some class action suits of this kind have been awarded fairly generous judgements. That wouldn't be so bad, would it Mr. Singer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor. (GEARY looks at him oddly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ph.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! I thought you were a mailman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why aren't you teaching? Why aren't you in a university?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too messed up to teach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Well then, they're going to have to pay for that, aren't they? The MEN all nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB and the others exit the OFFICE BUILDING. They are j clasping hands and smacking each other on the back. We wa break up. JACOB heads for the subway. FRANK and another g cab. As the cab pulls away we notice that a black car pul it. It follows them out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB and JEZZIE are making wild and unadulterated love o floor. The wastebasket flips over. JACOB's hand splashes bowl. Nothing impedes their passion. JEZZIE laughs, holle swoons. Hands grab hold of table legs. Chairs topple. Fee against the stove. It is all mayhem and ecstacy. And then JACOB's face is ecstatic. He can barely talk and simply b JEZZIE's glow. She looks especially lovely and radiant. T exhausted and exhilarated on the linoleum floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me ... am I still an angel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling broadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With wings. You transport me, you know that? You carry me away. JEZZIE kisses him softly around his face and gently probe her pinky. JACOB loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all angels, you know ... (she bites his earlobe. He winces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and devils. It's just what you choose to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underneath all the bullshit, just love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I feel ... exorcised ... like the demons are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come? The army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way. At least now I have some idea of what was happening. If we can only get them to admit ... to explain what they did ... I don't know. Maybe it'd clear things up in my head. I'll tell you something, Jez, honestly ... I thought they were real. Silence. Suddenly JEZZIE roars like a monster and scares death. They laugh and tumble back to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB emerges from the bathroom shower and pulls on a rob moving rapidly around the KITCHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put a frozen dinner in the oven, a Manhandler. It'll be ready at a quarter of. I threw a little salad together. It's in the fridge. I also bought some apple juice, Red Cheek. Don't drink it all. Oh, and Jake, your lawyer called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did? When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her coat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you were in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't give me a chance. (she pauses nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, honey, don't get upset, but he's not taking your case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you didn't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. That's all he said. He wasn't very friendly. Oh, yeah. He said your buddies backed down. They chickened out, he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I'm sorry. I feel terrible. I'd stay and talk but I'm so late. Look, don't be upset. We'll talk when I get home. See you around midnight. (she kisses him on the cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. And don't brood. Watch T.V. or something.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB'S APT./FRANK'S APT.
dialogues.text: The door slams securely. The locks set. JACOB begins inst through a desk drawer. He comes up with a frayed address up a number. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank. It's Jake. Jacob SInger. We see FRANK standing at a window fingering the Venetian does not reply. The scene intercuts between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I just got a strange call from Geary. He said the guys backed down. What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fingering the Venetian blinds)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean, Frank? I don't get it. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, try, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can. It's just that war is war. Things happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things happen? What the fuck are you talking about? They did something to us, Frank. We have to expose this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to expose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Who's been talking to you? (silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? How can you just turn away? (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not interested, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! You know it's not half the case if I go it alone. We're all suffering the same symptoms, Frank. The army is to blame. They've done something to us. How can you not want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not the army, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's a larger truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the demons are real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. What kind of bullshit is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Jake. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? What kind of mumbo jumbo ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother to call again, okay? FRANK hangs up. JACOB stands holding the phone for a long the high pitched whine from the receiver reminds him it's The sound frightens him and he slams the receiver down. Q tears through his address book looking for other phone nu aren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge wooden door slams open. JACOB charges through it. He is chasing his lawyer, DONALD GEARY, through a crowded corridor. GEARY, sweaty and unshaven, is cradling a Coke sandwich and a briefcase in the other. His stomach bounce walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geary! Mr. Geary! Listen, goddamn it! You can't just walk away from this. GEARY keeps walking. JACOB catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's been talking to you? The army? Have they been talking to you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's been talking to nobody. You don't have a case, you hear me? It's pure and simple. Now leave me alone. Okay? JACOB grabs the back of GEARY's jacket and pulls him up s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your hands off me! JACOB lets go. He stares into GEARY's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, will you listen? They're trying to get me. They're comin' out of the walls. The army's done something to me. I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need ... a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctor? And what's he gonna do, tell me I'm crazy? They've fucked with my head. I've got to prove it. You've got to do something. GEARY gives JACOB a pitiful look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do. He turns and walks away. JACOB stands there a moment, and after him. GEARY is biting into his sandwich. Mayonnaise spills onto his hand. He licks it with his ton catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind? I'm eating, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on here. You're not telling me something. What the hell's gotten into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's gotten into me. I don't know you from Adam, right? You come to my office with this bizarro story and demand I look into it. Okay. I said I'd check it out and I did. Now I don't know what kind of fool you take me for, but you have used and abused me, and I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to the Army's Bureau of Records. You've never even been to Viet Nam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thus at the core of today's discu- sion we find four fundamental doc- trines. First, that the world of matter and individual consciousness are both manifestations of one Divine Reality. One of the STUDENTS seems about to fall asleep and keeps his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

A door opens in the upper reaches of the lecture hall. JA enters and walks quietly down the stairs to within hearin of the professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third, man possesses a double nature, an ego and an eternal self, what we call "spirit" or "soul." JACOB takes a seat at one of the desks. There is a pencil on it which he fingers distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth, and most important, man's life on earth has only one end and purpose, to learn to let go of the separate ego and to identify with the Divine spark within. MR. PALMER is nodding off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, having reached this apotheosis there seems little, if anything, left to say. So rather than try, you are dismissed. The STUDENTS seem surprised but not unhappy with the sudd dismissal. They quickly gather their books and begin the climb to the exits. Only JACOB remains seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: JACOB and PROFESSOR STERN are sitting at a quiet table in nearly empty coffee shop. They are both fixing cups of te speaking. Suddenly JACOB looks at STERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I know how it sounds.

dialogues.text: Have you considered a doctor? A psy- chiatrist?

dialogues.text: I don't want them. I'm not looking for analysis or drugs. It's too easy to dismiss as some kind of psychosis. (he pauses uncomforta- bly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than that. I can feel it. I need you Prof. You're the only one I can talk to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say.

dialogues.text: I need your insight, your intuition. STERN sips his tea slowly. He is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid, Prof. Nothing makes sense. (he pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be delicate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, I don't believe in demons, not in the empirical sense. I don't be- lieve in devils fighting for our souls. I don't believe in enternal damnation. I don't believe in other- worldly creatures tormenting us. We don't need them. We do a good enough job on ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I don't pretend to know what's going on inside your head. For all I know it's pathological and they should be pumping Valium into your veins by the quart. But if you're not willing to accept the help of sci- ence; and believe me, I admire you for that: then you'll have to do bat- tle on your own. What can I say? It's a lonely pilgrimage through our times even for the strongest souls. But to be pursued by ... demons no less ... There are no guides, Jacob. (he muses)
